bows.description: La princesa Zelda te dio este arco y flecha para la batalla con la bestia oscura Ganon. Cuando es manejado por el héroe, dispara flechas de luz pura lo suficientemente fuertes como para oponerse a la Calamidad.
bows.name: Bow of Light

bows.description: A small bow used by travelers for protection. It doesn't do a lot of damage, but it can be used to attack foes from a distance.
bows.name: Traveler's Bow

bows.description: A bow designed for armed conflict. Inflicts more damage than a civilian bow, but it will still burn if it touches fire.
bows.name: Soldier's Bow

bows.description: The sturdy metal construction of this bow offers superior durability, while its lack of firing quirks makes it quite reliable. Once favored by the knights at Hyrule Castle.
bows.name: Knight's Bow

bows.description: In the past, the king of Hyrule presented this bow to only the most talented archers in the land. Its combat capabilities are as impressive as its extravagant design.
bows.name: Royal Bow

bows.description: The Koroks made this bow for Hylians. It's crafted from flexible wood and uses sturdy vines for the bowstring. Its construction may be simple, but it fires multiple arrows at once.
bows.name: Forest Dweller's Bow

bows.description: A bow favored by the Zora for fishing. It doesn't boast the highest firepower, but the special metal it's crafted from prioritizes durability.
bows.name: Silver Bow

bows.description: This bow is a favorite among Rito warriors. The bowstring has been specially engineered for aerial combat, which allows it to be drawn faster than a normal bow.
bows.name: Swallow Bow

bows.description: A highly refined Rito-made bow created by a master Rito craftsman. Rito warriors favor it for its superior rate of fire, which helps them excel even further at aerial combat.
bows.name: Falcon Bow

bows.description: A bow without equal wielded by the Rito Champion, Revali. It's said Revali could loose arrows with the speed of a gale, making him supreme in aerial combat.
bows.name: Great Eagle Bow

bows.description: This Gerudo-made bow is popular for the fine ornamentations along its limbs. Designed for hunting and warfare alike, this bow was engineered to strike distant targets.
bows.name: Golden Bow

bows.description: A bow passed down through the Sheikah tribe. Concentrating before drawing the string will allow you to target distant enemies as easily as those nearby.
bows.name: Phrenic Bow

bows.description: This bow is the result of Robbie's research. Ancient Sheikah technology allows it heightened functionality, Arrows fired from it travel in a perfectly straight line.
bows.name: Ancient Bow

bows.description: This prototype Sheikah-made bow was designed to fight the Great Calamity. made with ancient technology, it boasts a high rate of fire and firepower but has low durability.
bows.name: Royal Guard's Bow

bows.description: A bow used by the princess who fought the beasts of twilight alongside the hero. It's said to contain the spirits of light's power. It fires arrows straight and true, as if beams of light.
bows.name: Twilight Bow

bows.description: A basic Bokoblin bow made of wood. It's made by taking any tree branch and tying a string to either end, so don't expect much in the way of combat effectiveness.
bows.name: Boko Bow

bows.description: An upgraded Boko Bow bound with animal bone to boost its durability and firepower. Its craftsmanship is sloppy, but it's light and easy to use.
bows.name: Spiked Boko Bow

bows.description: A Boko bow reinforced by fossils. Bokoblins handpicked the materials it's made from, so it boasts a respectable firepower.
bows.name: Dragon Bone Boko Bow

bows.description: A wooden bow created by Lizalfos. It's reinforced by the bones of a large fish - a marked improvement over any standard wooden bow.
bows.name: Lizal Bow

bows.description: A Lizal bow with a grip reinforced by metal. The body is made from the branches of a flexible tree that grows near water, which offers some serious destructive power.
bows.name: Strengthened Lizal Bow

bows.description: This bow is wielded by lizalfos who are expert marksmen. The metal that reinforces much of the weapon adds some additional weight but offers heightened durability.
bows.name: Steel Lizal Bow

bows.description: A Lynel-made bow crafted from rough metal. True to the vicious nature of Lynel weaponry. It fires a spread of multiple arrows at once. Ideal for taking down quick-moving targets.
bows.name: Lynel Bow

bows.description: This massive Lynel bow sports a bowstring made from a metal so tough, mere Hylians have trouble drawing it back.
bows.name: Mighty Lynel Bow

bows.description: This Lynel bow is made from a special steel found at the peak of Death Mountain. It has tremendous stopping power and can pierce thick armor as easily as thin paper.
bows.name: Savage Lynel Bow

bows.description: A bow favored by the skilled archers of the Yiga Clan. It's been engineered to fire two arrows at once to ensure your target comes to a swift and none-too-pleasant halt.
bows.name: Duplex Bow

0.description: A menudo se encuentran en el suelo cerca de los árboles. Las ardillas adoran esta tuerca, por lo que puede tener competencia mientras se alimenta. Añadir uno a una comida para un condimento de nuez.
0.name: Bellota

1.description: A fossilized resin with a caramelesque sheen to it. It's been valued as a component in decorations and crafting since ancient times.
1.name: Amber
1.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

2.description: This crystal was made using lost technology. At one time it was the power source for ancient machines. This item is very valuable to researchers.
2.name: Ancient Core
2.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

3.description: A gear used in ancient machinery. Despite being incredibly old, its build quality is leaps and bounds above anything built using current technology.
3.name: Ancient Gear
3.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

4.description: A screw used in ancient machinery. It's made of an unknown material, and no matter how many times it's turned, its threads never seem to show signs of wear.
4.name: Ancient Screw
4.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

5.description: A machine part used in ancient machinery. It's incredibly sturdy, and it's not made of any recognizable material. It may come in handy someday.
5.name: Ancient Shaft
5.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

6.description: A spring used in ancient machinery. It is light and buoyant enough to float on water, and no matter how many times it's compressed, it never loses tension.
6.name: Ancient Spring
6.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

7.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
7.name: Manzana

8.description: This tough medicinal plant cannot be broken, but it can be cooked. Its durable yet flexible fibers raise your defense when cooked into a dish.
8.name: Armoranth

9.description: Calcium deposits in the scales of this ancient fish make them as hard as armor. Cooking it into a dish will fortify your bones, temporarily increasing your defense.
9.name: Armored Carp

10.description: This porgy's body is covered in armor-hard scales. The compounds in its scales, when cooked into a dish, fortify your bones and temporarily boost your defense.
10.name: Armored Porgy

11.description: This hearty radish has grown much larger than the average radish. It's rich in analeptic compounds that, when cooked into a dish, temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
11.name: Big Hearty Radish
11.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

12.description: Years of going unpicked have allowed this hearty truffle to grow quite large. It's chock-full of nutrients. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
12.name: Big Hearty Truffle
12.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

13.description: A fresh bird egg necessary for making dishes such as omelets and crepes. You can snag them from birds' nests if you're sneaky. Nutritious and delicious, perfect.
13.name: Bird Egg

14.description: This beetle's razor-sharp horns demand that you handle it with care. Boil the horns alongside monster parts to concoct an elixir that will raise your attack power.
14.name: Bladed Rhino Beetle
14.uses: Can make elixirs that raise attack power

15.description: A plant that grows in quieter areas of Hyrule. At night, it gives off a soft glow. Cook with it to increase your stealth.
15.name: Blue Nightshade
15.uses:
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

16.description: A tooth obtained from a Bokoblin. It's worn down and not very sharp, but it's still pretty hard. Cook it alongside a critter to make an elixir.
16.name: Bokoblin Fang
16.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

17.description: A rare material obtained by defeating a Bokoblin. It convulses on its own every now and then, which is really creepy, but perhaps it has a use.
17.name: Bokoblin Guts
17.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

18.description: The severed horn of a Bokoblin, a creature often encountered on the plains of Hyrule. It isn't edible, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to make an elixir.
18.name: Bokoblin Horn
18.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

19.description: This crab appears in large numbers when it rains. On bite of its delectable meat, and you'll forget all your exhaustion. Replenishes your stamina when cooked into a dish.
19.name: Bright-Eyed Crab

20.description: When boiled with other ingredients, the cane breaks down into a sweet juice necessary for making cakes and other sweets. It's commonly found in ingredients stores.
20.name: Cane Sugar
20.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

21.description: Small birds love this nut. You can eat it raw for a minor effect, but it can also be added as a spice to other recipes.
21.name: Chickaloo Tree Nut

22.description: This blue trout prefers cold bodies of water. Its skin contains enzymes that keep its body cool, and when cooked into a dish, it will temporarily boost your heat resistance.
22.name: Chillfin Trout
22.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

23.description: Often found at the base of pine trees in cold climates, these mushrooms are cool to the touch and can be used to cook dishes that allow you to stay cool even in arid regions.
23.name: Chillshroom
23.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

24.description: A gelatinous substance that came from a Chuchu. It's unusable in this state, but applying a bit of elemental stimulation will change its form.
24.name: Chuchu Jelly
24.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

25.description: This dragonfly prefers the cool shade of trees to the warmth of the sun. Its wings disperse heat from its body, which can be cooked into a heat-resistant elixir.
25.name: Cold Darner
25.uses: Can make elixirs that raise heat resistance

26.description: This medicinal plant grows in high elevations, such as mountains in the Hebra or Gerudo regions. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your heat resistance.
26.name: Cool Safflina

27.description: Honey straight from the hive is chock-full of nutrients. Cooking this into a meal unlocks the potential of these nutrients and provides a stamina-recovery effect.
27.name: Courser Bee Honey
27.uses:
Restores
Restores stamina when cooked
Armor upgrades

28.description: The most precious gem one can find in Hyrule, its signature sparkle has charmed Hyruleans for generations. As such, it has sold for a very high price since ancient times.
28.name: Diamond
28.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Champion weapon crafting

29.description: This valuable claw was plucked from the red spirit Dinraal. It was extremely hot before it was removed. You could sell it to a store, but it must have some other use.
29.name: Dinraal's Claw
29.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

30.description: This precious scale fell from the red spirit Dinraal. It emanates a great heat, You can use it in cooking, but eating it seems like a waste.
30.name: Dinraal's Scale
30.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

31.description: This rare dragonfly only appears in the rain. Its wings direct electricity away from its body. Cook it with monster parts for an electricity-resistant elixir.
31.name: Electric Darner
31.uses: Can make elixirs that raise shock resistance

32.name: Electric Keese Wing
32.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

33.description: This medicinal plant grows abundantly in the Gerudo Desert. Its peculiar fibers conduct electricity, which will increase your electricity resistance when cooked into a dish.
33.name: Electric Safflina

34.description: This valuable beetle can live up to ten years. When cooked with monster parts, its impressive vitality translates into an elixir that will greatly restore your stamina.
34.name: Energetic Rhino Beetle
34.uses:
Can make elixirs that restore stamina
Armor upgrades

35.description: Highly valued as a medicinal plant, this carrot contains large amounts of nourishing energy. When cooked into a dish, it boosts your stamina beyond its maximum limit.
35.name: Endura Carrot
35.uses:
Restores
Used in cooking to increase max stamina
Fed to horses to increase max horse stamina

36.description: A rare yellowish-orange mushroom. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your stamina limit.
36.name: Endura Shroom
36.uses:
Restores
Increases max stamina when cooked

37.description: This fairy will fly from your pouch and heal all your wounds the moment you lose your last heart. It's easily mistaken for a firefly at first, but it glows in the daylight as well as night.
37.name: Fairy

38.description: This claw was plucked from the golden spirit Farosh. Its electricity was expelled before it was removed, so it's safe to handle. A store will buy it, but it must have some other use.
38.name: Farosh's Claw
38.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

39.description: This precious scale fell from the golden spirit Farosh. It contains powerful electricity within. You can cook it, but eating it seems like a waste.
39.name: Farosh's Scale
39.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

40.description: A rare Fire Keese wing. There isn't enough Fire Keese attached to it to burn you, but it does have a slight warmth to it. It can be used as an ingredient for elixirs.
40.name: Fire Keese Wing
40.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

41.description: This rare lizard can only be found in the Eldin region. Its scales have heat-resistant properties, so when cooked with monster parts, it produces a heat-resistant elixir.
41.name: Fireproof Lizard
41.uses:
Can make elixirs that raise heat resistance
Armor upgrades

42.description: The plant that bears these seeds grows near deep water. The roots draw nutrients from the water, which boosts your movement speed when the seeds are cooked into a dish.
42.name: Fleet-Lotus Seeds

43.description: Strike it with a metallic weapon to generate a spark. The portable fire starter breaks after one use, but it can create a long-lasting flame if you use it near firewood.
43.name: Flint

44.description: An extremely tough pumpkin raised in village fields. When cooked, that toughness manifests itself by considerably upping defense.
44.name: Fortified Pumpkin

45.description: This fresh milk comes from Hateno cows and white goats kept in the village. It's delicious on its own but can also be used as an ingredient in soups and stews.
45.name: Fresh Milk

46.description: A giant energy crystal made using lost ancient technology. Cores this large are an extremely rare find. A researcher would probably know how to use this.
46.name: Giant Ancient Core
46.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

47.description: Butter made from the milk of a domesticated white goat. In addition to being used in dishes like stews and meunière. It's often used when making cakes and other sweets.
47.name: Goat Butter
47.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

48.description: Made from several types of spices, this secret Goron seasoning has been handed down for generations. An initial wave of spiciness paves the way for the sweetness.
48.name: Goron Spice
48.uses: General cooking and specific cooking recipes

49.description: This large fish lives near the shoreline. Its sizable body can restore a lot of nutrient. When cooked into a dish, it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
49.name: Hearty Bass
49.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked
Armor upgrades

50.description: This snail lives on sandy beaches in large numbers. Its flesh contains a high amount of stimulants, so when cooked into a dish, it temporarily increases your maximum hearts.
50.name: Hearty Blueshell Snail
50.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

51.description: This fruit's odor earned it the nickname "king of fruits". It offers immense restorative power; dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
51.name: Hearty Durian
51.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

52.description: This rare lizard lives deep in the forests. It feeds on high-nutrient foods, giving it great vitality. When used to make elixirs, they temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
52.name: Hearty Lizard
52.uses: Can make elixirs which increase max hearts

53.description: A rare radish that grows best in sunny plains. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
53.name: Hearty Radish
53.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

54.description: This fish makes its home in cold water, giving it extra layers of fat. It temporarily increases your maximum hearts when used in cooking.
54.name: Hearty Salmon
54.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

55.description: This rare mushroom has a rich scent. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your maximum hearts.
55.name: Hearty Truffle
55.uses:
Restores
Increases max hearts when cooked

56.description: A lizard found throughout Hyrule. It's a bit slow to react at times, but if given a chance to escape, it will dart off quickly. Cook it with monster parts for a speed-boosting elixir.
56.name: Hightail Lizard
56.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase speed
Armor upgrades

57.description: A giant, smelly Hinox organ of unknown function. Upon closer inspection, it appears to be quivering, It can be used to make an elixir, but some say it has other uses, as well.
57.name: Hinox Guts
57.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

58.description: A nail obtained from a Hinox. It's as thick as a plate of armor and can be stewed with critters to make elixirs.
58.name: Hinox Toenail
58.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

59.description: A tooth obtained from a Hinox. It's so large, it's hard to believe it's a real tooth. It can be used to make elixirs.
59.name: Hinox Tooth
59.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

60.description: A quick frog that can be found hopping around near water. Cook it with monster parts to draw out its speed-boost effect.
60.name: Hot-Footed Frog
60.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase speed
Armor upgrades

61.description: This resilient fruit can flourish even in the heat of the desert. The hydrating liquid inside provides a cooling effect that, when cooked, increases your heat resistance.
61.name: Hydromelon
61.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

62.description: This grain is a favorite among residents of Kakariko Village. It's grown in regions with a lot of water and is quite versatile. Used as an ingredient in things like risotto and rice balls.
62.name: Hylian Rice

63.description: A common mushroom found near trees around Hyrule. Eat it to restore half a heart.
63.name: Hylian Shroom

64.description: An ordinary fish that can be found all over Hyrule. Can be eaten raw, but cooking it amplifies its healing benefits.
64.name: Hyrule Bass

65.description: This healthy herb grows abundantly in the plains of Hyrule. Cook it before eating to increase the number of hearts it restores.
65.name: Hyrule Herb

66.description: A rare Ice Keese wing. Its frozen surface gleams attractively, but its usefulness isn't readily apparent.
66.name: Ice Keese Wing
66.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

67.description: The severed tail of an Ice-Breath Lizalfos. Its hard scales and flesh make it unsuitable for cooking, but it's perfect for making elixirs.
67.name: Icy Lizalfos Tail
67.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

68.description: This crab's shell is particularly hard. When cooked into a dish, its fat and meat bolster the body to increase your defense.
68.name: Ironshell Crab

69.description: The cap of this mushroom is very hard. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that increases your defense.
69.name: Ironshroom

70.description: A rare material dropped by a defeated Keese. It's fun to look at, but it doesn't seem to have much use at first glance. But it must be good for something...
70.name: Keese Eyeball
70.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

71.description: The wing of a Keese. It's covered with very short, sharp fur. It's not much use by itself, but you can mix it with critters to make something useful.
71.name: Keese Wing
71.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

72.description: This winding horn once grew atop the head of a Lizalfos. It's too hard to use for cooking, but stores are willing to buy it from you. It can also be used to make elixirs.
72.name: Lizalfos Horn
72.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

73.description: This talon once grew from the elbow of a Lizalfos. You can stew it with critters to make elixirs, but it may have some other uses, as well.
73.name: Lizalfos Talon
73.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

74.description: The severed tail of a Lizalfos. It continues to wriggle even after being separated from its body. That kind of vitality makes it highly valued as an ingredient in elixirs.
74.name: Lizalfos Tail
74.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

75.description: This mysterious mineral gives off a pale blue glow in the dark, which some believe to be souls of the undead. Apparently, this stone can be used as a base to make special clothing.
75.name: Luminous Stone
75.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades
Trading for Diamonds

76.description: This highly sought-after ingredient can only be obtained from a Lynel. It pulses with the vitality of a Lynel, a strength that makes it invaluable as an ingredient for elixirs.
76.name: Lynel Guts
76.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

77.description: This rare ingredient can be obtained only from a Lynel's foot. It's larger and heavier than a horse's hoof. It's useful for making elixirs but may have uses beyond that.
77.name: Lynel Hoof
77.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

78.description: The Lynel this horn once grew upon surely misses it. It's exceptionally hard—so hard that most blades cannot scratch it. Throw it into a stew with critters to make elixirs.
78.name: Lynel Horn
78.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

79.description: This fruit grows mainly in tropical forests of the Faron region. When it's used as an ingredient, the resulting dish will temporarily increase your attack power.
79.name: Mighty Bananas
79.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

80.description: This freshwater fish lives alongside its less mighty carp ilk. A compound in its liver promotes muscle growth. Dishes cooked with it will temporarily increase your attack power.
80.name: Mighty Carp
80.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

81.description: This ocean-dwelling fish comes with one rude attitude. The compounds in its flesh elevate your competitive spirit when it's cooked into a dish, thus increasing your attack power.
81.name: Mighty Porgy
81.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

82.description: This medicinal plant is known for its sharp thorns and for the fruit it bears. The fruit contains a compound that increases attack power when cooked into a dish.
82.name: Mighty Thistle

83.description: A sharp fang obtained from a Moblin. It's too hard to be reshaped into a tool, but it can be tossed into a stew with some critters to create elixirs.
83.name: Moblin Fang
83.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

84.description: This prized ingredient can be obtained from Moblins. Its odor is too pungent for normal food preparation, but stew it with some critters to make elixirs.
84.name: Moblin Guts
84.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

85.description: This splendid horn once grew atop the head of a Moblin. It can't be used in normal food recipes, but it does have some use as an ingredient in making elixirs.
85.name: Moblin Horn
85.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

86.description: A sturdy fin obtained from a Molduga. It can be used to make elixirs, but there may be someone willing to trade for it.
86.name: Molduga Fin
86.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

87.description: A giant organ obtained from a Molduga. This invaluable ingredient is hard to come by, and its use is shrouded in mystery.
87.name: Molduga Guts
87.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades
Quests

88.description: A result of Kilton's research into monsters, this suspicious spice can be used to punch up dishes while cooking. Apparently it can be used to make a number of monstrous meals.
88.name: Monster Extract
88.uses: Restores or removes a random number of Hearts

89.description: This valuable claw was plucked from the blue spirit Naydra. It was freezing cold before it was removed. You could sell it, but there must be some other use for it.
89.name: Naydra's Claw
89.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

90.description: This precious scale fell from the blue spirit Naydra. It contains a bitter cold within. You can use it in cooking, but just eating it seems like a waste.
90.name: Naydra's Scale
90.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

91.description: This inflatable Octorok organ has a lot of lift, so attach it to items you want to see float. Hold it in your hands, and then place it on an object to attach it.
91.name: Octo Balloon
91.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

92.description: This can only be obtained from an Octorok-type enemy. You can sell it to a store, or you can make elixirs with it, but it may have other uses, as well.
92.name: Octorok Eyeball
92.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

93.description: This can only be obtained from an Octorok-type enemy. It's too acidic for cooking, but it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
93.name: Octorok Tentacle
93.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon

94.description: A valuable ore that gives off a mesmerizing iridescence similar to the inside of a seashell. It contains the power of water.
94.name: Opal
94.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

95.description: Fruit from palm trees that grow near the ocean. It doesn't offer any special effects but will increase your heart recovery when used as an ingredient.
95.name: Palm Fruit

96.description: A high-quality piece of meat that's hard to come by. You can eat it raw, but cooking it first will recover more hearts.
96.name: Raw Bird Thigh

97.description: This meat is tougher and chewier than a standard steak. Tastes better cooked.
97.name: Raw Bird Drumstick

98.description: This prized cut of meat is usually from a large animal. Any connoisseur would rank this tender, juicy cut of meat "gourmet." Expect an exquisite meal when cooking with this.
98.name: Raw Gourmet Meat

99.description: Meat obtained from animals in plains and forests. You can eat it raw, but cooking it will make it more delicious and nutritious.
99.name: Raw Meat

100.description: A fresh, high-quality piece of animal meat. This stuff isn't easy to come by, so savor it. Cook it to recover more hearts.
100.name: Raw Prime Meat

101.description: This prized meat can be obtained from certain birds. It gets full points for flavor, nutrition, and volume. It pairs perfectly with other ingredients or can be enjoyed alone.
101.name: Raw Whole Bird

102.description: This crab is well known for its exceptionally sharp pincers. When cooked, the strength compound in its claws will increase your attack power.
102.name: Razorclaw Crab
102.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

103.description: This mushroom is known for the natural slice in its cap. Eating it fosters your competitive spirit. Use it when cooking to prepare a dish that will increase your strength.
103.name: Razorshroom
103.uses:
Restores
Raises attack power when cooked

104.description: A jiggly substance that normally comes from a Fire Chuchu. It constantly gives off heat. If struck, it will explode in a ball of flame.
104.name: Red Chuchu Jelly
104.uses:
Can be created by heating Chuchu jelly over an open flame or killing any ChuChu with a flame weapon
Armor upgrades

105.description: The severed tail of a Fire-Breath Lizalfos. Its flavor makes the flesh inedible, but toss it into a stew with some critters, and you'll have yourself a nice elixir.
105.name: Red Lizalfos Tail
105.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

106.description: A very energetic cricket. Cook it with monster parts to create a stamina-recovery elixir.
106.name: Restless Cricket
106.uses: Can make elixirs that restore stamina

107.description: Crystallized salt from the ancient sea commonly used to season meals. Cannot be eaten in this form.
107.name: Rock Salt

108.description: A precious red gem mined from large ore deposits found throughout Hyrule. Rubies contain the power of fire and have fetched a high price since ancient times.
108.name: Ruby
108.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

109.description: This beetle's hard body resembles armor. When the shell is cooked with monster parts, the resulting elixir boosts your defense.
109.name: Rugged Rhino Beetle
109.uses: Can make elixirs that boost defense

110.description: A mushroom that can grow almost anywhere but prefers ceilings and sheer cliffs. Cook it before eating to temporarily increase your movement speed.
110.name: Rushroom
110.uses:
Restores
Increases speed when cooked
Armor upgrades

111.description: This wild armored carp has been bred into a prizewinning fish. Its beautifully colored markings do not occur in nature. It offers no special effects when cooked.
111.name: Sanke Carp

112.description: A precious blue gem mined from natural rock formations. Sapphires contain the very essence of ice. They've been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
112.name: Sapphire
112.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

113.description: This shard fell from the red spirit Dinraal's fang. It's exceptionally hard and therefore impossible to process, but apparently it can be used as a material for something.
113.name: Shard of Dinraal's Fang
113.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

114.description: This shard chipped and fell off the red spirit Dinraal. Its horn is said to be the crystallized power of fire itself. It sells for a high price, but rumors say there's some other use for it.
114.name: Shard of Dinraal's Horn
114.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades
Armor upgrades

115.description: This shard fell from the golden spirit Farosh's fang. It's so hard, hammers bounce right off it, so it's impossible to process. Yet rumors say it does have some use as a material.
115.name: Shard of Farosh's Fang
115.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

116.description: This shard fell off the golden spirit Farosh. It's said the horn is the crystallized power of electricity itself. It sells for a lot, but there must be some other use for it.
116.name: Shard of Farosh's Horn
116.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

117.description: This shard fell from the blue spirit Naydra's fang. It's much harder than any metal, so it's impossible to process. Yet rumors say it can be used as a material for something.
117.name: Shard of Naydra's Fang
117.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

118.description: This shard chipped and fell off the blue spirit Naydra. It's said the horn is the crystallized power of ice itself. It sells for quite a bit, but rumors say it has some other use.
118.name: Shard of Naydra's Horn
118.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

119.description: This lovely flower was said to have been a favorite of the princess of Hyrule. Once feared to have gone extinct, it's recently been spotted growing in the wild.
119.name: Silent Princess
119.uses:
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

120.description: A strange mushroom that glows quietly in the forest at night. Cooking it into a dish unlocks the nutrients in its cap, resulting in a meal that will allow you to move stealthily.
120.name: Silent Shroom
120.uses:
Restores
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

121.description: This red trout prefers warm bodies of water. It has a special organ specifically for storing heat. When cooked into a dish, it temporarily boosts your resistance to the cold.
121.name: Sizzlefin Trout
121.uses:
Restores
Boosts cold resistance when cooked

122.description: This rare butterfly lives in volcanic regions. Its body contains a heat-resistant liquid, which can be turned into a topical elixir that offers resistance to flames.
122.name: Smotherwing Butterfly
122.uses:
Can make elixirs which boost heat resistance
Armor upgrades

123.description: This large, glow-in-the-dark snail lives in fresh water. When cooked into a dish, it heightens your senses so you can move about silently.
123.name: Sneaky River Snail
123.uses:
Restores
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

124.description: This pepper is exploding with spice. Cook with it to create dishes that will raise your body temperature and help you withstand the cold.
124.name: Spicy Pepper
124.uses:
Restores
Boosts heat resistance when cooked

125.description: A green mushroom that grows near trees in the forest. It's chock-full of natural energy. Cook it to release its stamina-restoration properties.
125.name: Stamella Shroom

126.description: This Hyrule bass got to be the biggest fish by never getting caught (until now). Its long life results in a cooked dish that will restore a lot of stamina.
126.name: Staminoka Bass

127.description: A mysterious stone fragment that fell from the sky. It looks like it would fetch a good price, but you may be able to use it in certain recipes as well.
127.name: Star Fragment

128.description: Consuming the bioluminescent compound that makes this fish glow in the dark will increase concentration. Dishes cooked with it will suppress noise when consumed.
128.name: Stealthfin Trout
128.uses:
Restores
Increases stealth when cooked
Armor upgrades

129.description: A butterfly found in the woods and plains of warm regions. Its wings absorb the warmth of the sun. Cook it with monster parts to create an elixir that makes you feel warm and fuzzy.
129.name: Summerwing Butterfly
129.uses: Can make elixirs which boost cold resistance

130.description: These fireflies glow gently in the dark. When cooked with monster parts, the compound that causes it to glow results in an elixir that will allow you to move more quietly.
130.name: Sunset Firefly
130.uses:
Can make elixirs which increase stealth
Armor upgrades

131.description: A bright red mushroom that grows in hot climates. Imbued with the power of heat, they can be used to cook dishes that will allow you to endure the bitter cold.
131.name: Sunshroom
131.uses:
Restores
Boosts cold resistance when cooked
Armor upgrades

132.description: This carrot is cultivated extensively in Kakariko Village. It strengthens the legs and hips when cooked into a dish, which helps increase your movement speed.
132.name: Swift Carrot

133.description: This vitality-rich flower blooms mainly on cliffsides. When cooked into a dish, the nourishing compounds increase your movement speed.
133.name: Swift Violet
133.uses:
Increases speed when cooked
Armor upgrades

134.description: This grain is cultivated extensively on the Tabantha Plains. It's ground finely with a millstone to be used in cooking. Use it to make things such as stews and breads.
134.name: Tabantha Wheat

135.description: This rare butterfly only shows itself when it rains. The organs in its body produce an insulating compound. When made into an elixir, it offers electrical resistance.
135.name: Thunderwing Butterfly
135.uses: Can make elixirs which boost shock resistance

136.description: This rare frog only ventures out in the rain. When cooked with monster parts, the elixir it produces will temporarily increase your maximum stamina.
136.name: Tireless Frog
136.uses: Can make elixirs which increase max stamina

137.description: This precious yellow gem contains the power of electricity. It's been known to fetch a high price since ancient times.
137.name: Topaz
137.uses:
Sold for Rupees
Armor crafting
Armor upgrades

138.description: This trout makes its home in the freshwater lakes. Its scales have an insulating compound that, when cooked into a dish, offers resistance to electricity.
138.name: Voltfin Trout
138.uses:
Restores
Boosts shock resistance when cooked

139.description: Cacti found in the Gerudo Desert bear this sweet fruit. It's naturally insulated, so when cooked into a dish, it provides resistance against electricity.
139.name: Voltfruit
139.uses:
Restores
Boosts shock resistance when cooked
Armor upgrades

140.description: This dragonfly has a special organ that causes it to sweat profusely. Cook it with monster parts for an elixir that will raise your core temperatures so you can resist the cold.
140.name: Warm Darner
140.uses: Can make elixirs which boost cold resistance

141.description: This medicinal plant grows in hot regions, such as the Gerudo Desert. It's warm to the touch and increases your cold resistance when cooked into a dish.
141.name: Warm Safflina
141.uses:
Boosts cold resistance when cooked
Armor upgrades

142.description: A jiggly substance that came from an Ice Chuchu. It's cool to the touch, and squeezing it seems to relieve stress. If struck, it will explode in a cold mist.
142.name: White Chuchu Jelly
142.uses:
Can be created by killing any ChuChu with an Ice weapon
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

143.description: A fruit that grows in cold, snowy regions known for its tangy, sweet flavor. It doesn't offer any special effects, but it's a popular cooking ingredient.
143.name: Wildberry

144.description: The powdery scales of this butterfly's wings cool the air around it. Watching it flutter around snowflakes is a thing of beauty. Cook it with monster parts for a heat-resistant elixir.
144.name: Winterwing Butterfly

145.description: A portable bundle of wood. You can use this to make a campfire if you have something to light it.
145.name: Wood

146.description: A jiggly substance that came from an Electric Chuchu. Electricity pulses through its gelatinous mass. If struck, it will explode in a burst of electric current.
146.name: Yellow Chuchu Jelly
146.uses:
Can be created by killing any Chuchu with an electric weapon
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

147.description: The severed tail of an Electric Lizalfos. Its powerful stench makes it unappetizing and unfit for cooking, but it's highly valued as an ingredient for elixirs.
147.name: Yellow Lizalfos Tail
147.uses:
Elixir creation
Sold for Rupees and Mon
Armor upgrades

148.description: This mushroom grows wild in the Gerudo region. The cap is naturally insulated, so when used in cooking, it will offer protection against electricity.
148.name: Zapshroom
148.uses:
Restores
Boosts shock resistance when cooked
Armor upgrades

0.description: A menudo se encuentran en el suelo cerca de los árboles. Las ardillas adoran esta tuerca, por lo que puede tener competencia mientras se alimenta. Añadir uno a una comida para un condimento de nuez.
0.name: Bellota

1.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
1.name: Manzana

2.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
2.name: Manzana

3.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
3.name: Manzana

4.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
4.name: Manzana

5.description: Una fruta común que se encuentra en los árboles alrededor de Hyrule. Cómalo fresco o cocínelo para aumentar su efecto.
5.name: Manzana

weapons.description: La espada legendaria que sella la oscuridad. Su hoja brilla con un brillo sagrado que puede oponerse a la calamidad. Sólo un héroe elegido por la espada misma puede empuñarla
weapons.name: Master Sword

weapons.description: Wooden branches such as this are pretty common, but it's surprisingly well-balanced. It doesn't do much damage but can serve as a weapon in a pinch.
weapons.name: Tree Branch

weapons.description: This torch will stay lit once ignited. If you put it away, the flame will be extinguished until you light it again.
weapons.name: Torch

weapons.description: A kitchen implement often used for serving delicious soups. It was carved from the wood of a sturdy tree, so it actually packs quite the wallop.
weapons.name: Soup Ladle

weapons.description: This throwing weapon was originally used by the forest-dwelling Koroks. Its unique shape allows it to return after being thrown.
weapons.name: Boomerang

weapons.description: This strange hammer is one of Kilton's specialties. Being struck by it doesn't hurt much, but the fourth swing in a string of attacks will send the victim flying.
weapons.name: Spring-Loaded Hammer

weapons.description: A very common sword often kept by travelers to fend off small beasts. It's fairly durable, but a bit unreliable against monsters.
weapons.name: Traveler's Sword

weapons.description: A sword brandished by the soldiers who once protected Hyrule Castle. Its durable blade is well tuned for slaying monsters.
weapons.name: Soldier's Broadsword

weapons.description: Knights of Hyrule once carried this sword. These days it's the weapon of choice for seasoned adventurers thanks to its ease of use and high attack power.
weapons.name: Knight's Broadsword

weapons.description: The Hyrulean royal family would award this sword to knights who achieved remarkable feats. A sword that balances strength and beauty as elegantly as this one is a rare find.
weapons.name: Royal Broadsword

weapons.description: Koroks made this sword for Hylians. It's made of wood, so it isn't the best choice for head-on attacks. Its original intent was likely clearing vines to forge paths through forests.
weapons.name: Forest Dweller's Sword

weapons.description: The ornamentation that adorns this blade is a traditional Zora design. It's forged from a very durable and rust-proof metal.
weapons.name: Zora Sword

weapons.description: Rito craftsmen forged this lightweight, double-edge sword so Rito warriors could soar into battle unhindered by its weight.
weapons.name: Feathered Edge

weapons.description: This common sword is often carried by Gerudo women for self-defense. Its short, curved blade is easily recognized.
weapons.name: Gerudo Scimitar

weapons.description: Delicate Gerudo carvings decorate this curved sword. The engraved blade is extremely sharp. Apparently it once served ceremonial purposes in festivals.
weapons.name: Moonlight Scimitar

weapons.description: A famous sword once beloved by the Gerudo Champion Urbosa. It is said that when Urbosa swung this sword in battle, her movements resembled a beautiful dance.
weapons.name: Scimitar of the Seven

weapons.description: A single-edged sword traditional to the Sheikah tribe. Forged using ancient technology it just may be among the sharpest conventional weapons ever made.
weapons.name: Eightfold Blade

weapons.description: The blade of this sword was made using an ancient power lost to this modern age. Its blade appears only when drawn, and its cutting power surpasses metal swords.
weapons.name: Ancient Short Sword

weapons.description: A rusty sword used ages ago by a skilled swordsman. It can do some damage in the right hands but also breaks quickly.
weapons.name: Rusty Broadsword

weapons.description: A Sheikah-made replica of the sword that seals the darkness. It was made with ancient technology to oppose the Great Calamity, but its low durability made it inefficient.
weapons.name: Royal Guard's Sword

weapons.description: This magical sword was forged in the lava of Death Mountain. It leaves white-hot flames in its wake when the blade glows red.
weapons.name: Flameblade

weapons.description: A magical sword forged in the frigid mountains of the Hebra region. When the blade glows blue, enemies struck by it will become frozen.
weapons.name: Frostblade

weapons.description: A magical sword forged and refined by lightning from the Hyrule Hills. When the blade shines with a golden light, it will electrocute enemies struck by it.
weapons.name: Thunderblade

weapons.description: A sword said to have once belonged to a hero from the sky. Its blade houses the fire of the Goddess. When wielded, a strange yet heavenly breeze kicks up around you.
weapons.name: Goddess Sword

weapons.description: A sword once wielded by a hero in an ancient age. When grasped, a strange sense of nostalgia washes over you. Take it when going alone would otherwise be dangerous.
weapons.name: Sword

weapons.description: A boomerang said to have been used by a hero who traveled the Great Sea. It smells faintly of salt water.
weapons.name: Sea-Breeze Boomerang

weapons.description: A crude Bokoblin club made to clobber small prey. It's essentially a stick, so its durability is low.
weapons.name: Boko Club

weapons.description: A reinforced Bokoblin club made to maximize damage. The sharpened bones jabbed into it make it a brutal weapon.
weapons.name: Spiked Boko Club

weapons.description: This Bokoblin club has been reinforced with fossilized bones to maximize clobbering potential. Only the brawniest of Bokoblins can manage its immense weight.
weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Club

weapons.description: A curved sword favored by the Lizalfos. It can be used to attack directly or can be thrown like a boomerang.
weapons.name: Lizal Boomerang

weapons.description: Blue Lizalfos in particular like this weapon. It has one more blade than the Lizal boomerang to give it additional cutting power, and it still returns when thrown.
weapons.name: Lizal Forked Boomerang

weapons.description: More blades means more attack power! It can be used as a boomerang, but all those blades makes that a bit more dangerous. Carried by Black Lizalfos seasoned in battle.
weapons.name: Lizal Tri-Boomerang

weapons.description: A sword often wielded by Guardian Scouts. Its blue energy blade is a product of ancient technology. It's not very durable.
weapons.name: Guardian Sword

weapons.description: This Guardian sword has enhanced power over the standard model. Its cutting capabilities are improved, and its durability has seen a slight uptick.
weapons.name: Guardian Sword+

weapons.description: The abilities of this Guardian sword have been boosted to the maximum, as evidenced by its increase in size. It slices through armor like a hot knife through butter!
weapons.name: Guardian Sword++

weapons.description: This Lynel-made sword was designed with smashing in mind rather than slicing. It's on the heavy side compared to what Hylians are used to, but it's very strong.
weapons.name: Lynel Sword

weapons.description: This Lynel-made sword boasts more blades and more attack power. A skilled Lynel can draw this sword simply in passing and still cut a foe in two.
weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Sword

weapons.description: A brutal sword carried by white-haired Lynels. The savage blades are strong enough to cut down any foe, no matter how strong.
weapons.name: Savage Lynel Sword

weapons.description: A magical rod that can cast three fireballs at once, crafted by an ancient magician. It will break upon running out of magical energy, so make it last!
weapons.name: Meteor Rod

weapons.description: A magical rod crafted from refined ice found in the Hebra Mountains. This rod can cast waves of freezing air. Great for magic—not so great for melee.
weapons.name: Ice Rod

weapons.description: A magical rod that can cast extreme cold in a wide range. These are crafted from refined ice found at the summit of Hebra Peak. It will break when depleted.
weapons.name: Blizzard Rod

weapons.description: A magical rod that can shoot balls of electricity. Its gem contains lightning from the Hyrule Hills. It's not recommended to use as a melee weapon.
weapons.name: Lightning Rod

weapons.description: A magical rod that can hurl three balls of electricity at once. Its gem contains electricity from the Hyrule Hills, and the rod will break when that electricity runs out.
weapons.name: Thunderstorm Rod

weapons.description: A grim weapon favored by the Yiga. The half-moon shape of the blade allows for the rapid delivery of fatal wounds and serves as a symbol of their terror. Its durability is low.
weapons.name: Vicious Sickle

weapons.description: This lethal weapon is forged by the Yiga. Its unique shape facilitates the sound dispatching of any target and strikes fear into the hearts of all who see it.
weapons.name: Demon Carver

weapons.description: A skeletal arm that keeps moving even after it's severed from its body. It's kind of gross to strap it to your back, but it'll do in a pinch. It's old and fragile, so it's quick to break.
weapons.name: Bokoblin Arm

weapons.description: The arm of a Stalizalfos that continues to struggle even in death. It can be used as a weapon, but it's very brittle. You can feel it wiggling when you strap it to your back...
weapons.name: Lizalfos Arm

weapons.description: A single swing of this giant, sturdy leaf can create a gust of wind strong enough to blow away light objects.
weapons.name: Korok Leaf

weapons.description: A farming tool primarily used for tilling fields. Its fine craftsmanship is sturdy enough to withstand backbreaking fieldwork, but its battle applications are untested.
weapons.name: Farming Hoe

weapons.description: Made for paddling boats, but it was made sturdy enough to fight strong currents. Maybe it's useful for self-defense in a pinch.
weapons.name: Boat Oar

weapons.description: A woodcutter's tool of choice for felling trees. Its formidable weight and uneven balancing make it a slow, inefficient weapon.
weapons.name: Woodcutter's Axe

weapons.description: This double-sided axe was designed with fighting in mind. It's a bit unwieldy, so it requires a well-practiced technique to use efficiently.
weapons.name: Double Axe

weapons.description: This large iron sledgehammer was originally used for mining, but it works reasonably well as a weapon too.
weapons.name: Iron Sledgehammer

weapons.description: This massive boomerang requires two hands. Originally used for hunting, it was modified for use as a weapon. The blades on the inner curves make it a bit tricky to wield.
weapons.name: Giant Boomerang

weapons.description: A basic two-handed sword often wielded by aspiring adventurers. Its immense weight can knock enemies' shields right out of their hands.
weapons.name: Traveler's Claymore

weapons.description: A two-handed sword designed for combat. It's heavy and hard to use but has decent build quality and durability.
weapons.name: Soldier's Claymore

weapons.description: Only the most confident of Hyrule Castle's knights carried this two-handed sword. Its cutting edge is finely honed.
weapons.name: Knight's Claymore

weapons.description: A two-handed sword issued to the Hyrulean royal family's immediate guard detail. Its powerful strikes are said to crush an opponent's body and resolve alike.
weapons.name: Royal Claymore

weapons.description: Although the Zora prefer spears to swords, they made this two-handed weapon using a special metal. It found popularity among Hylians for its unique design.
weapons.name: Silver Longsword

weapons.description: A Goron-made two-handed weapon. It's made from thick, hard metal and has no cutting edge, so it relies on its sheer weight to crush all opponents.
weapons.name: Cobble Crusher

weapons.description: A two-handed weapon forged from a rare metal mined in Goron City. Its center of gravity is at its tip, so it uses centrifugal force and its sheer weight to smash opponents flat.
weapons.name: Stone Smasher

weapons.description: This two-handed weapon was once wielded by the Goron Champion Daruk. Daruk made swinging it around look easy, but a Hylian would need an immense amount of strength.
weapons.name: Boulder Breaker

weapons.description: Only the most talented Gerudo sword fighters carry this two-handed sword. It's actually much lighter than it appears and is surprisingly easy to wield.
weapons.name: Golden Claymore

weapons.description: A single-edged sword seldom seen in Hyrule. This weapon is passed down through the Sheikah tribe and has an astonishingly sharp edge ideal for slicing.
weapons.name: Eightfold Longblade

weapons.description: A curious double-edged sword crafted using Sheikah technology. It was originally made for Hyrulean knights unfamiliar with single-edged blades.
weapons.name: Edge of Duality

weapons.description: This two-handed sword was forged using ancient Sheikah technology. Its unique rotating blades give it impressive cutting power that will slice enemies to shreds.
weapons.name: Ancient Bladesaw

weapons.description: A two-handed sword not properly cared for. Although it can be used as a weapon, its durability is very low. Don't expect it to last for more than a few strikes.
weapons.name: Rusty Claymore

weapons.description: The Sheikah used the very essence of ancient technology to forge this greatsword. It was designed to oppose the Calamity, but its low durability made it impractical in battle.
weapons.name: Royal Guard's Claymore

weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged in the fires of Death Mountain by Goron smiths in an ancient age. Attack when the blade glows red to expel flames.
weapons.name: Great Flameblade

weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged by smelting ore found in the Hebra Mountains' permafrost. Attack when the blade glows blue to expel freezing air.
weapons.name: Great Frostblade

weapons.description: This magic-infused greatsword was forged by the Hyrulean royal family using lightning from the Hyrule Hills. Attack when the blade glows golden to expel lightning.
weapons.name: Great Thunderblade

weapons.description: The Six Sages are said to have forged this longsword to seal a demon king in the world where the hero fought against the beasts of twilight. The blade shines with a holy luster.
weapons.name: Sword of the Six Sages

weapons.description: A legendary greatsword forged by a Goron craftsman for a hero who traveled through time. The exceptionally sharp cutting edge is a testament to the craftsman's mastery.
weapons.name: Biggoron's Sword

weapons.description: A peculiar greatsword allegedly used by a hero from a world in which the moon threatened to fall. It slashes wildly in battle as if possessed by a fierce deity.
weapons.name: Fierce Deity Sword

weapons.description: A clunky club made by a Bokoblin. If you swing it at an enemy's shield, it may be able to knock the shield out of your foe's hand.
weapons.name: Boko Bat

weapons.description: After much consideration by Bokoblins on how to improve the Boko bat, they simply attached sharp spikes to it. A skilled fighter can cause immense damage with this.
weapons.name: Spiked Boko Bat

weapons.description: Used by only the toughest Bokoblin warriors, this Boko bat has been fortified by fossilized bone. It boasts a high durability and is strong enough to beat down powerful foes.
weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Bat

weapons.description: A crudely fashioned club favored by Moblins. It's carved from a sturdy tree but is sloppily made, so it breaks easily.
weapons.name: Moblin Club

weapons.description: Animal bone has been affixed to this Moblin club to greatly improve its damage.
weapons.name: Spiked Moblin Club

weapons.description: The bone of an ancient beast has been affixed to this Moblin club, further increasing its damage. Moblins carrying these in battle are particularly dangerous.
weapons.name: Dragonbone Moblin Club

weapons.description: A weapon used by Guardian Scouts. Its unique blade was forged using ancient technology. Although powerful, its unusual shape causes it to break easily.
weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe

weapons.description: This ancient battle axe's damage output has been increased to maximum. It's sharp enough to cut through almost anything, so it may have been used to forge new routes.
weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe+

weapons.description: This ancient battle axe's damage output is scaled up to peak performance. Ancient technology makes it possible to enhance cutting power beyond metal weapons' limits.
weapons.name: Ancient Battle Axe++

weapons.description: This two-handed weapon is favored by the Lynels. It may be more accurate to call it a lump of metal than a weapon, but if wielded by a Lynel, it can pound you into a fine dust.
weapons.name: Lynel Crusher

weapons.description: This Lynel-made two-handed weapon has been reinforced to increase its durability and striking power. Its overwhelming heft will crush your foe, shield and all.
weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Crusher

weapons.description: This Lynel-made two-handed weapon is immensely heavy thanks to a rare metal from Death Mountain's peak. The power of its downward swing is in a class all its own.
weapons.name: Savage Lynel Crusher

weapons.description: This sword is favored by high-ranking members of the Yiga. When wielded by a proficient fighter, its unique shape cleaves the very wind and creates a vacuum.
weapons.name: Windcleaver

weapons.description: A Moblin bone that continues to move even after being detached from its body. The bone is thick enough to be used as a weapon but is extremely brittle and easily broken.
weapons.name: Moblin Arm

weapons.description: Just a mop to the untrained eye, it excels at tidying up the place. But it owes its sturdy construction to a true craftsman, so it actually has some combat merit.
weapons.name: Wooden Mop

weapons.description: A farming tool used to collect hay efficiently. It's light enough to be used by anyone. The four prongs are very sharp.
weapons.name: Farmer's Pitchfork

weapons.description: A fisherman's tool that excels at catching large fish. Its particularly sharp spearhead makes it valuable as a weapon as well.
weapons.name: Fishing Harpoon

weapons.description: A specialized spear weighted to excel as a throwing weapon. It's perfectly balanced to be thrown farther than your average spear, able to pierce targets from a great distance.
weapons.name: Throwing Spear

weapons.description: A spear used mainly by travelers to fend off wolves and other beasts. It's easy to hold and simple to use.
weapons.name: Traveler's Spear

weapons.description: A long spear once used by the guards of Hyrule Castle. Easy to use but difficult to master. The iron tip is very sturdy and the shaft will not burn when exposed to flame.
weapons.name: Soldier's Spear

weapons.description: A spear used by knights adept in mounted combat. The spearhead is modeled after an axe.
weapons.name: Knight's Halberd

weapons.description: This spear was issued to the knights who guarded Hyrule Castle's throne room. Its ornate design was applied by a craftsman in service to the royal family.
weapons.name: Royal Halberd

weapons.description: The Koroks made this spear for Hylians. The shaft is made from a light, sturdy wood, offering ease of use. The spearhead is made from a much harder wood, offering strength.
weapons.name: Forest Dweller's Spear

weapons.description: This spear is a Zora's weapon of choice. It's lighter than it looks due to being made from a special metal and is used by the Zora for both fishing and protecting their domain.
weapons.name: Zora Spear

weapons.description: The most skilled Zora fighters wield this spear. Its beautiful fish-tail design belies its impressive strength; the spearhead can pierce even the toughest scales.
weapons.name: Silverscale Spear

weapons.description: A spear modeled after the Lightscale Trident wielded by the Zora Champion Mipha. They may be identical in appearance, but this spear's strength and durability are inferior.
weapons.name: Ceremonial Trident

weapons.description: A spear of peerless grace cherished by the Zora Champion Mipha. Although Mipha specialized in healing abilities, her spearmanship was in a class all its own.
weapons.name: Lightscale Trident

weapons.description: Goron artisans used recycled metal to forge this weapon. The tip is made from an old excavation bore, which affords it unmatched piercing capabilities.
weapons.name: Drillshaft

weapons.description: Its lightweight design is a hallmark of Rito craftsmanship. It's made from light and sturdy materials, which afford Rito warriors ease of use during aerial combat.
weapons.name: Feathered Spear

weapons.description: This spear's center of gravity is in its tip, making it a bit unwieldy for the average fighter. But in the hands of a skilled Gerudo warrior, it's a weapon of reliable strength.
weapons.name: Gerudo Spear

weapons.description: The spearhead of this weapon is uniquely Sheikah in design. Spear masters of the Sheikah tribe can use the crescent shape to snag their opponents and deliver brutal cuts.
weapons.name: Serpentine Spear

weapons.description: This spear is the result of countless hours of research into the ancient technology used by Guardians. The glowing spearhead has high piercing potential.
weapons.name: Ancient Spear

weapons.description: A rusty polearm likely used by knights from an age past. The spearhead is in bad shape due to prolonged exposure to the elements, so its durability is low.
weapons.name: Rusty Halberd

weapons.description: This Sheikah-made spear was created using ancient technology to combat the Calamity. Its attack power is very high, but a critical design flaw left it with poor durability.
weapons.name: Royal Guard's Spear

weapons.description: A magical spear forged in the magma of Death Mountain. Attack when the blade glows to expel powerful flames.
weapons.name: Flamespear

weapons.description: A magical spear forged from ancient ice taken from the Hebra Mountains. Attack when the blade glows blue to chill the air and freeze your foe.
weapons.name: Frostspear

weapons.description: A magical spear that contains thunder from Thundra Plateau in its tip. Attack when the blade glows with a golden light to unleash an electrical attack.
weapons.name: Thunderspear

weapons.description: A spear recklessly carved from a tree branch. Useful for skewering fish and meat, which can then be cooked over a flame. If it's close to breaking, consider throwing it.
weapons.name: Boko Spear

weapons.description: A Boko spear enhanced with sharpened animal bones. It's light, easy to use, and deals a decent amount of damage.
weapons.name: Spiked Boko Spear

weapons.description: This Boko spear has been strengthened with fossilized bones. The bones are positioned outward so the fangs bite at the opponent. Beware Bokoblins carrying this weapon.
weapons.name: Dragonbone Boko Spear

weapons.description: This wooden spear is most often used by Moblins. It's made from a hastily whittled tree, so its stabbing power and durability are both pretty low.
weapons.name: Moblin Spear

weapons.description: This Moblin-made spear uses a horned animal bone as the spearhead. Like many Moblin weapons it's sloppily made, but this one packs some respectable piercing power.
weapons.name: Spiked Moblin Spear

weapons.description: This spear is a fan favorite among Moblins. The spearhead is made from fossilized bones adorned with spikes, which greatly increases its stabbing power.
weapons.name: Dragonbone Moblin Spear

weapons.description: The brutal, ripping edge of this weapon’s spearhead is a distinctly Lizalfos design. Its low durability doesn’t lend itself to extended use.
weapons.name: Lizal Spear

weapons.description: Judging by the harpoon-like spearhead of this Lizalfos-made spear, the Lizalfos use it for fishing as well as combat. Try not to get caught on the wrong end of its barbs.
weapons.name: Enhanced Lizal Spear

weapons.description: Skilled Lizalfos warriors tend to favor this spear. What it lacks in piercing power, it makes up for with the brutal wounds its dual ripping blades will inflict.
weapons.name: Forked Lizal Spear

weapons.description: Wielded by Guardian Scouts, this spear has a high piercing power and is a testament to the Sheikah's high level of technology. the spearhead appears only when brandished.
weapons.name: Guardian Spear

weapons.description: The tip of this Guardian spear has been enlarged and strengthened. It's a bit shorter than your average spear, perhaps to facilitate use in tight spaces.
weapons.name: Guardian Spear+

weapons.description: This Guardian spear's output has been boosted to the maximum. The spearhead is designed for optimal stabbing, capable of easily piercing most armor.
weapons.name: Guardian Spear++

weapons.description: The crescent-shaped spearhead of this Lynel-made weapon gives it poor balance, making it difficult to wield. Lynels, however, can swing it effectively with a single hand.
weapons.name: Lynel Spear

weapons.description: The weight and cutting edge of this Lynel-made spear have both been enhanced. It's immensely heavy for a Hylian, but a Lynel can cleave through rock with a single swing.
weapons.name: Mighty Lynel Spear

weapons.description: White-haired Lynels favor this brutal spear. Its axe-like spearhead and exceptional weight give it absolute destructive power.
weapons.name: Savage Lynel Spear
